headline: The Trump administration’s big Intel investment comes from already awarded grants

headline: Is There an Opportunity in Intel After Announcing $100 Billion Ohio Chip Expansion?
summary: Are you standing at the crossroads with Intel stock, wondering whether to double down, hold steady, or head for the exit? You are not alone. Intel has seen its share price move in both directions lately, keeping investors on their toes and sparking new debates about the company's true value. Over just the last three months, the stock jumped more than 23%, hinting at renewed optimism after a challenging spell in the semiconductor world. Year-to-date gains are firmly in double digits as well...

headline: Did Trump save Intel? Not really, analysts say.
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -U.S. President Donald Trump is injecting nearly $9 billion into Intel in exchange for a 9.9% equity stake.  What Intel needs is external customers for its so-called cutting-edge 14A manufacturing process - a tough ask, at least in the short term.  CEO Lip Bu Tan, who took the top job in March, warned last month that the company may have to quit the chip contracting business if it does not land any big clients.

CEO Lip Bu Tan, who took the top job in March, warned last month that the company may have to quit the chip contracting business if it does not land any big clients.

headline: Who is spending the most and least in tech?
summary: Investing.com -- Tech stocks paused last week as investors reassessed spending patterns across the sector, with UBS highlighting both the biggest and smallest spenders on capital expenditure (capex) and research and development (R&D).
